group_1.textRight: What kinda mom do you think you'll be?

group_1.textLeft: Huh? Where'd that come from?@What do you mean?

group_1.textRight: Well...
Well, say you get married and have kids.
Would you want to have...
A boy and a girl, like you and your brother?

group_1.textLeft: Now that I think about it...
I really do like having a brother...

group_1.textRight: Okay.
What kinda dads do you think the @guys on the baseball team will be?

group_1.textLeft: Heh, it's too far in the future.@I honestly have no clue.

group_1.textRight: Right?
But we're all going to be@grown-ups someday.
We'll go to high school,@where we'll study like crazy...
We'll join the baseball team there,@probably fall in love with someone...
But, uh oh.@Now it's time to go to college...
Years from now there'll be a whole@new set of choices to worry over.
And then after that, waaay far off@in the future...
...we'll all get married, and maybe @have kids...
And we'll all come back for reunions @and such.
Maybe we'll even say stuff to each other@like, "Wow, you're getting old!" Right?
Well, don't you want to see@how everybody turns out?
Don't you want to be able to see @everyone again once we're grown-ups?
Yeah, our future selves.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah... Yeah,[chara:300201:cheek_1] I guess I do...

group_1.textRight: Doesn't it? I think so.
I bet you'll make a great mom!
But yeah, change is scary...
But wanting things to stay the same...
...means you might miss out on@some really cool things down the line.
So, would you still rather everyone@stay right where they are, forever?
You help drive everyone to succeed, Natsuki.
And like we said at your@house, not just in baseball.
You push people to be better in life, too.
You push them toward a better future.
